description: {"blocks":[{"key":"31bup","text":"Nova-ST is a an open-source, high-resolution sequencing based spatial transcriptomics workflow. This method gives comparable resolution to BGI Stereoseq, SeqScope \u0026 PIXEL seq. Nova-ST is derived from dense nano-patterned randomly barcoded Illumina NovaSeq 6000 S4 sequencing flow cells. More details in the Nova-ST pre-print. Nova-ST enables customized, low cost, flexible, and high-resolution spatial profiling of broad range of tissue section sizes (upto 10mm x 8 mm). In this protocol, we provide detailed step-by-step resource for implementing the Nova-ST spatial transcriptomics workflow in you lab. Bioinformatics and data analysis workflows are detailed in: https://github.com/aertslab/Nova-ST. For any protocol related or data analysis clarifications, you can reach out to us via nova.st.aertslab@gmail.com. {"blocks":[{"key":"3k2te","text":"Retrieve the 24-well plate with Nova-ST chip stored in the 1X IDT TE (  ) buffer from the   fridge. Remove the parafilm seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","id":0,"number":"8"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eq88o","text":"Chose the desired chip number/s from the storage plate. Register the corresponding Nova-ST chip ID/s (this will be needed for later ST data analysis).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"p9ma","text":"Remove and discard the storage TE buffer from the corresponding well/s. Using a sharp forceps retrieve the Nova-ST chip/s and place it into a fresh 24 well plate (the functional surface of the chip must face the top). Ensure not to disturb the functional surface of the Nova-ST while handling the chip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6bbl","text":"Add 3 ml of NFW, drop by drop on to the surface of the chip to to wash the the chip. Discard the wash and repeat this step for a total of 3X times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2t5uh","text":"Transfer the chip to fresh well in the 24 well plate. Using either an air gun or pressurized air canister, blow away excess liquid on the surface of the chips. With the help of forceps, transfer the chip to the thermocycler adapter at 37*C. Incubate for 1 min for the chip to dry. Then proceed for the cryo-sectioning of the tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n8jo","text":"Follow the 10X Genomics Visium Tissue Preparation guide, to place 8 consecutive tissue section in the capture area slots of the Visium Spatial Tissue Optimization Slide (PN: 3000394). The optimization slide with sectioned tissue can be preserved at -80oC as recommended by the manufacturer. {"blocks":[{"key":"d8e4c","text":"Prepare 100mg/ml of pepsin stock by dissolving the pepsin powder with 0.1N HCl (  ). Mix the solution with P1000 pipette, till the enzyme is homogenized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"m3tp","text":"Once the glass slide has cooled to cryostat temperature, add 2 drops of OCT on the glass slide to hold the Nova-ST chip on the glass slide and to prevent the chip from sliding away from the slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13mga","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"sgno","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":21,"offset":93}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"avi7b","text":"This is important for cryostats where the sample stage of the cryostat is inclined.
